title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth        Kid's Quarters gives 7-11 year olds the chance to perform hands-on work of the 1840's soldier, craftsman, laborer, cook, trapper, and trader.  NPS Photo       Kid's Quarters July 9, 2016 The event provides seven to eleven year old children the chance to "step back in time" and learn skills of the 1800's. Children are split into groups of trappers, traders, laborers, blacksmiths and carpenters, Indians, and soldiers. Adult living history historians guide the children through normal life and work routines of the 1840's fur trading post.  Call (719) 383-5026 for an application or print on off from this website starting May 1, 2016.  Junior Ranger Program Children of all ages have fun using the Junior Ranger book to explore the fort. After they complete the acitivities, they can receive a Junior Ranger Badge.           National Park Web Ranger Have fun with the National Park Service Web Ranger Site. Click here to enter.
